answers.answer: I actually use a few options: RxAccess for my test strips, lancets, etc: http://www.rxaccess4u.com/rx4u/and Novo Nordisk will give you free insulin if you sign up and meet their requirements: http://www.novonordisk-us.com/documents/article_page/document/Patient_Assistance_DBM.aspThere are quite a few assistance programs out there that should help :)

I dont know what insurance your friend has but I have Medical Mutual of Ohio and they have a program called the SuperWell Disease Management .  I just found out about it recently and it has saved me a lot of money.  The Insulin is not free but you do get free test strips, lancets, syringes, and alcohol wipes
Thank you for your help..I'll find out what type of insurance he has and tell him to ask about the disease management program.
Thank you for your help..I'll find out what type of insurance he has and tell him to ask about the disease management program.

question: Does anyone know where to get free diabetic supplies. I have a friend who has a 16 year old daughter with diabetes. He has insurance but it still is costing him a lot of money in doctor bills and supplies. We live in Ohio, can anyone help me find a site or an organization to help him?? Thank you and God Bless
title: HELP WITH DAIBETIC SUPPLIES
